title: I'm actually glad that there isn't a Tribunal anymore
body:
Jk. But in all seriousness, I was chat banned for 8 games back in March. I know this was a long time ago but it's still relevant since there isn't a Tribunal still.  I haven't had any ban on my account in a long ass time. I even got the free skin for being a good member of the community last year around Christmas (Nunubot).  I can't even remember even getting any of those pop ups that happen after the game saying you were reported for X behavior.

I tried to get to the bottom of it by submitting a ticket and what follows are the emails back and forth.  My first email to them was on March 11th and the last one I received from Riot regarding my inquiry was on April 9th. Talk about an expedient process. 

All I wanted was to find out what on earth I did to receive a ban.  What I got can be summed up with, "You were toxic. Don't be toxic"  Brilliant.  

Their response when I asked what I did wrong so I can correct my behavior (The first email for the second jpg)  actually pissed me off a little because it came off as "too bad, deal with it, move along now" when I nicely asked what I did wrong so I can fix my mistakes.  

The entire process is fairly frustrating because they handed out a punishment and told me to stop being toxic but they didn't explain really how I was being toxic, wouldn't give me chat logs to show me the context of my toxic behavior, wouldn't tell me the kind of reports I got and almost took an entire month to get what little info I could out of them.  

A+ Riot A+

Leaving aside whether or not this player deserved punishment or not (it's not actually really relevant), the complete lack of info is pretty abysmal.

I'm all for punishing players for toxic behaviour, but letting them know exactly what they did wrong is an important step in actually letting them improve their behaviour.
